Articles.Content:
Designed an aircraft the uses a SAS roller bearing mechanism to turn a propeller.

Here Kenlo Kerman climbs the ladder.

He is very determined not to die this time.

Flight!

Here's a video of it in action, if you don't mind listening to my commentary, and the beautiful songs of my computer fan in the background.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QVHdkiuwx8A&feature=youtu.be

How has no one replied? This is an amazing craft! I hope Squad doesn't add propellers just for the soul purpose of new player-made designs and crafts like this! With propellers added to the game, where would the challenge be?

+Rep

First I've seen of it, and I have to say, this is awesome, in fact all craft like this are

Really well done Pourpaya, and so compact, all that's missing is a craft file.

This is amazing! IÃ‚Â´ve seen some stock helicopters around here, but this beats everything!

And yes, a craft file would be nice.

Great job! I support any and all spinning contraptions around.

I've made some stock propeller planes but none had enough power to get off the ground, or at least go faster than a walking pace.

I am pretty impressed!

Designed an aircraft the uses a SAS roller bearing mechanism to turn a propeller.

This looks cool as boop. Also... would I be correct in assuming this thing can re-dock the propeller to be stored as the single ship by going to another scene and switching back?

Rune. One of these days, I've got to build myself one!

Thanks everyone!

This particular model is low performance and very hard to coax into flight, so I'm shying away from posting craft files.

I have a better engine on the way though, so I may post that eventually so that other people can build their own craft with it.
